Line 45: Line 45:
Later, [[AIGLX]] would eliminate the need to use Xgl, and allow window managers to do 3D accelerated compositing on a standard X server, while still enabling [[Direct Rendering Infrastructure|DRI]] to reach the graphics card. Currently [[NVidia]], [[Intel]], and some [[ATI]] cards support AIGLX. ATI's support for AIGLX is currently limited to those cards which use their [[open source]] drivers.
Later, [[AIGLX]] would eliminate the need to use Xgl, and allow window managers to do 3D accelerated compositing on a standard X server, while still enabling [[Direct Rendering Infrastructure|DRI]] to reach the graphics card. Currently [[NVidia]], [[Intel]], and some [[ATI]] cards support AIGLX. ATI's support for AIGLX is currently limited to those cards which use their [[open source]] drivers.
â
[[Compiz]] is probably the most well known on Linux for its cube effect, and has been included in [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] Linux, enabled by default since version 7.10. It includes a wide array of impressive 2D and 3D effects and runs very well even on slightly older video hardware.
+
[[Compiz]] is probably the most well known on Linux for its cube effect, and has been included in [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] Linux, enabled by default since version 7.10. It includes a wide array of impressive 2D and 3D effects and runs very well even on slightly older video hardware.
